name: GDS210 Prototype 2: Unlucky & Mild
description:
The project was created by Jordan H. and Jesse A. This game was created to fit the brief for a project at SAE University Melbourne.

We were given the brief of taking an already existing arcade cabinet game from 1991 and prior and creating a new game with new mechanics on a mobile device that resembles this old game. We chose the Lucky and Wild driving and shooting co-op game. (Don't tell anyone, but while writing this, I found out the game was from 1992.)

The idea of the game is similar; the player's take control of a car driving on a road and shoot at targets. Instead of using an arcade steering wheel and light-gun however, the player instead has their phone and their fingers.

Controls:

Mobile Version:

Tilt phone left and right to steer the car.

Tap screen to to destroy car and bullseye targets

Credits:

(da_st) Stenfors, D. (2020). Toon Road Texture. Retrieved 24 July 2020, from https://opengameart.org/content/toon-road-texture (Edited by us for purposes.)

David's website (Condition of usage)

All other assets (Bullseye and Car targets, UI) were made by us.
